suffolk police is asking fans to allow extra time for journeys to and from the stadium , and to follow the directions of stewards and police officers at the ground .

documents.title: usain bolt was always going to beat me , says former school mate
text: as usain bolt sets his sights on breaking his 200m world record at the rio olym after winning the 100m , a former school mate tells me he 's not surprised the sprint legend won a third gold .
herdlyn evans , who 's appearing as part of the flying aces act at great yarmouth 's hippodrome , says bolt was one of the fastest kids in school in his age group .
but did he compete against him ?
`` no , i chose not to he was always going to beat me . ''
herdlyn says he remembers usain bolt 's first olym `` he came fifth or fourth in his first event , which i doubt most people remember . ''

he 's a phenomenal athlete an excellent role model for a lot of people a lot of people look up to him in jamaica and throughout the world everywhere you go and mention usain bolt , someone can relate to that . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: cheers ! corks pop for sparkling wine sales
text: britain 's thirst for prosecco and cava has seen a rise in sparkling wine sales over the last few years , with more than 31.6m gallons sold in 2015/16 compared to 17.6m four years earlier .

jeremy dunn , from the norfolk wine school , is not surprised , as `` prosecco is a very accessible way of drinking fizz , bringing in a whole new wave of customers into sparkling wine sales in pubs , bars , restaurants and clubs prosecco sales are really booming . ''
the majority of sparkling wine is imported from france , spain and italy , but more is now being made at home .
last year , 37 new wine producers and vineyards opened in england .

we 're blessed in the uk the south east of england shares the same geological features as the champagne region of france so we 're actually able to grow the same grape and produce really world class sparkling wine right here in the uk . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paralysed motorbike champ rides again
text: a former norwich biking champion of the 1980s who was paralysed when he crashed at 120mph ( 193 km/h ) has returned and ridden the circuit where he broke his back .
phil armes , who won races in the isle of man and even china , crashed at the ulster grand prix in 1995 .
he returned to the circuit last year for the first time , but heavy rain meant he could n't ride .
this weekend , he successfully complete a lap ( seen above ) in front of more than 60,000 fans lining the 7.6 mile ( 10.7 km ) road circuit .
he described it as `` very emotional '' , and was glad to have a dark visor on as it gave him `` a few moments to compose himself before talking to the commentator at the end of the lap . ''
well done , phil , from all of us at the norfolk live team .

documents.title: city shop reopens after arson attack
text: an eastern european shop damaged in an arson attack in norwich last month has reopened .
a brick was reportedly thrown through the window of the village shop in magdalen street , and a small fire started in the early hours of 8 july .
two people inside a flat attached to the shop managed to escape unharmed .

people in norwich showed their support for the romanian shop , writing messages of support on love hearts , while a crowdfunding appeal on the justgiving website raised more than £ 30,000 to repair the store .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five drummers drumming to set new world record
text: it took 72 hours , one minute and 54 seconds for a group of dereham drummers to smash the guinness world record for the `` longest drumming marathon by a team . ''
but sadly it was all in vain .
a technical hitch with their camera meant jdt music academy did n't make it into the 2016 edition of the guinness book of records .
about four hours of footage was lost , leading to their claim being rejected .
undaunted , they 're now prepared to tackle the three day feat all over again .
over the august bank holiday , five drummers drumming will attempt to beat the current world record of 66 hours , with a whopping 80 hours of continuous drumming .

documents.title: teenage girl given go-ahead for brain tumour treatment
text: a teenage girl from great yarmouth has been told she can go to america to receive treatment for her brain tumour .
abbie boast was diagnosed in may after suffering from seizures .
doctors said the 14-year-old would need proton beam therapy , a form of radio therapy , which is n't yet available in the uk .
her mother , ali , says they 've been told the nhs has now approved the treatment abroad .
there 's a long way to go , it 's been a roller coaster ride so far and it 'll continue in that way but we feel we 're moving forward a bit . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

investigators have n't been able to confirm the cause of the blaze at the former mental asylum , but it 's believed to have been started deliberately .

documents.title: housing strategy is 'flawed '
text: a population explosion is expected in parts of the county by 2024 , according to the latest figures from the office for national statistics .
south norfolk will see the greatest rise - 12.5 - with norwich and breckland expecting just over 7 % .
it is anticipated all areas of norfolk will see at least 4 % more people living here over the next eight years .

an updated plan - the joint core strategy - published two years ago to deal with the main pressure areas of growth outlined that a minimum of 21,000 homes are needing in broadland , south norfolk and norwich alone .
stephen heard , who heads up snub - stop norwich urbanisation , said the strategy for housing in and around the city is flawed .

the whole concept of building an eco settlement is to make themselves sufficient in terms of public transport and job opportunities we do n't see any of that coming , all we see now with the northern distributor road is a leage dual carriageway road with no development to support it . ''

documents.title: norfolk christian project to reduce re-offending
text: community chaplaincy norfolk is a christian service supporting ex-offenders to successfully rebuild their lives after prison .
the project 's new co-ordinator , susan carne , spoke about her work recruiting volunteer mentors and sympathetic landlords .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: increasing population 'a threat ' to rural norfolk
text: norfolk 's rural landscape is under threat by mass strategic development .
that 's the concern being raised by the county 's branch of the campaign to protect rural england ( cpre ) .
it comes as figures from the office for national statistics ( ons ) suggest all areas will see population rise within 10 years by up to 12.5 % .
cpre norfolk 's senior planning trustee , david hook , says massive parts of countryside in broadland , norwich and south norfolk will be lost .

there are 72,000 houses going to be built to 2036 if strategic housing market assessments are followed - that will increase the population of the norwich area to 516,400 we will kill the golden goose that is rural norfolk if this happens . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: photo : shooting stars over norfolk
text: many thanks to ben gadsby-williams for this stunning photograph of meteors over norfolk on friday night .
the dazzling display of perseid meteors peaked on friday night , as the earth ploughed through a dense cloud of comet debris - with dozens of meteors streaking across the sky every hour .
if you have any photos or maybe a video that you 'd like to share , you can send them to us on email .

documents.title: south norfolk population set to increase
text: the population of south norfolk is set to rise by more than 12 % over the next decade , according to figures from the office for national statistics ( ons ) .

it 's predicted all parts of the county will see an increase but the biggest impact is likely to be in norwich , breckland and the south of the county , meaning more pressure on housing and services .

south norfolk district council is already meeting those demands , says leader john fuller , adding that it 's important for councils to match population growth and housing formation with quality of life .

you have to have a long-term plan once you 've got an idea of how many houses , you can communicate that to the water companies , the electricity companies - it takes 10 to 20 years to sort bits of infrastructure out - we 're planning and have delivered between 1,000 and 1,500 homes for each of the last 10 years or so and that was from a plan starting in 2006 . ''
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hospital fire believed to be sus
text: arson is believed to be the cause of a fire at a former mental asylum on the outskirts of norwich .
the derelict old plumstead hall was gutted in the blaze , which broke out early on sunday morning .
more than 50 firefighters attended the scene , and a controlled demolition was carried out for safety reasons in the afternoon .
assistant chief fire officer david ashworth says the building had stood empty for a number of years , with all windows and doors boarded up , and there was `` no obvious source of ignition '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a busy few days for norfolk 's fire crews
text: fire investigators are looking into the circumstances around three big blazes in norfolk in recent days .
on friday afternoon a coach caught fire on the a11 between wymondham and attleborough .
all of the 71 passengers , who were returning to luton after a day trip to great yarmouth , got off safely .
more than 50 firefighters spent saturday tackling a that broke out in 700 tonnes of waste at a scrapyard in west dereham .
and yesterday , a former mental asylum that 's been derelict for many years was destroyed in a fire .
little now remains of the old plumstead hall near norwich .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: king 's lynn driver filmed driving wrong way on m23
text: police have released video footage of an elderly motorist from norfolk who drove for six miles in the wrong direction on a motorway after he became confused after returning on a flight to the uk .
keith taylor pulled onto the hard shoulder of the m23 in sussex before making a u-turn , heading south on the northbound carriageway .

a sussex police spokesman said : `` despite oncoming headlights and evasive action taken by other motorists , the errant driver 's blue volkswagen polo hatchback continued doggedly in the wrong direction until police caught up with him near maidenbower , crawley . ''

the 79-year-old , from new road , burnham overy staithe near king 's lynn , pleaded guilty to dangerous driving and was sentenced on 25 july by magistrates to six months ' imprisonment , suspended for two years .
he was also disqualified from driving for two years and told he must take an extended driving test before reapplying for his licence .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: first female war photographer commissioned by imperial war museum
text: the first official female war photographer olive edis from sheringham , whose work goes on display at norwich castle in october , was commissioned by the imperial war museum to photograph women 's war work in europe .
she was the first british woman to be commissioned as an official war photographer and only the 5th official british photographer to visit europe to cover the first world war .
edis captured many images including a shot of ypres cloth hall in belgium ( above ) .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: exhibition of norfolk pioneer photographer to bring her to larger audience
text: an exhibition of the work of acclaimed sheringham photographer olive edis ( below ) called fishermen & kings at norwich castle aims to bring her to a larger audience , says the show 's curator .
the show will not be touring , although a smaller exhibition featuring different images will form part of the permanent display at the cromer museum in the future .
curator alistair murphy said : `` olive edis was a remarkable woman .

`` she was well-educated , forward thinking , a visionary , an astute business entrepreneur and , most importantly , a talented photographer with a natural affinity for her subjects - however grand or humble each was afforded respect and dignity .

`` edis 's photographic legacy is a 'national treasure ' and we are delighted to present , for the first time , this highly impressive display of her work , to be appreciated by a larger audience . ''
the exhibition starts on 8 october .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: norfolk female war photographer 's work at museum
text: the work of britain 's first female war photographer is going on display in the first major exhibition of her work .
olive edis ( above ) , from sheringham in norfolk , captured unique photographs of the western front at the end of world war one , as well as photographs of fishermen in norfolk and british royalty .
the exhibition , at the norwich castle museum and art gallery , running 8 october-22 january , will feature more than 190 rare photographs taken between 1900 and 1955 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

text: a man charged with manslaughter following the death of a six-month-old baby girl has had a trial date set for next month .

she was transferred to addenbrooke 's in cambridge where she died on 2 march .

documents.title: norfolk cadets mark 75th anniversary of air training corp
text: cadets are taking part in a torch relay across the county today to mark the 75th anniversary of the air training corps .
they set off from carrow road in norwich this morning and then went down the river wensum to pulls ferry before marching to norwich castle .
an open top bus will then take them to raf marham .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: have you ever thought about adopting a milestone ?
text: we 're being encouraged to take care of the hundreds of norfolk milestones
the plea comes from the milestone society , which restores and records many of the stone markers that appear on roadsides .
with about 360 of them in the county , they need some help , and the society is asking people to adopt a milestone and maintain it .
it 's the feeling for them , it 's part of our heritage , and if we lose our heritage generally , we 'll just lose our souls . ''
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: caister mum needs £ 1,500 to lower the kerb outside her home
text: a mum from caister is facing a £ 1,500 bill to help her four-year-old daughter get safely to their home .
stacey travis , whose daughter amber has severe autism , says lowering the kerb outside will mean she can park her car in front of her house , but she ca n't afford it .

she says it 's hard to always park outside or near their home , and amber struggles with that : `` with autism it is very strict routines and if you do n't go by amber 's normal daily routine it can affect her quite drastically . ''

norfolk county council , which is in charge of highways and social services , say that although amber is n't eligible for a disabilities facilites grant , a social worker can offer the family advice .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mum says she 'll 'struggle ' unless she can park outside her home
text: a mum from caister says she 's `` scared '' about the future , because she ca n't park near her house , and her daughter has severe autism and a physical condition , which means she ca n't walk far .
stacey travis wants to turn her front garden into a driveway , but she ca n't afford the £ 1,500 norfolk county council has said it will cost to carry out the work .
she says she 'll struggle to keep carrying amber as she grows : `` that is what 's scaring me , the future , what it 's going to be like for me and for her sister .
it 's heartbreaking to watch when she 's so upset . ''
norfolk county council says a social worker can offer the family advice , as amber is n't eligible for a disabilities facilities grant .

documents.title: calls for 'compromise ' in row over wymondham play area
text: there are calls for compromise in a row over a play area in wymondham which has escalated into a bitter feud .
campaigners are fighting plans by the town council to move the equipment at king 's head meadow , following complaints about noise .
the county council has now intervened and is trying to arrange talks between both sides .

doug underwood , who 's a town councillor , says a compromise is possible : `` as long as it does n't start off as a war before we actually start to resolve the issues , i think there 's a true opportunity here to do something and to resolve this once and for all . ''

documents.title: hazardous waste amnesty at recycling centres
text: there 's a chance for residents to get rid of unwanted toxic chemicals at a series of household hazardous waste amnesties at seven of norfolk county council 's recycling centres in september .
wood preservatives , bug and week killers , paint , thinners , varnishes and special cleaning products will be accepted .
these products are too dangerous to be tipped down drains and ca n't be disposed of in regular waste bins .
last year , 10,000 residents took advantage of the amnesties , disposing of 212 tonnes of household chemicals including 180 tonnes of unwanted paint .

text: yesterday we brought you news of disruption to rail services during august bank holiday while a bridge is replaced at long john hill in norwich .

documents.title: soul 10k run and family fun day for ymca norfolk
text: soul church in norwich are issuing an open invitation , welcoming all to join their 10k run and family fun day on monday , august 29 to raise funds for ymca norfolk .

documents.title: feel the force at fakenham racecourse
text: the star wars movies have inspired video games , a tv series , games - and lego .
a special collection of characters and machinery , all made out of the building bricks , has gone on display at fakenham racecourse .
each stable has a different scene from a different film in the series .
it 's taken adrian fletcher , and his wife diane , three years to put together .
at one stage there were more than 250 boxes of lego , filling the couple 's front room , dining room and bedrooms .
the exhibition runs until sunday - and then it will all be sold .
mr fletcher , who admits he 's both a star wars and lego fan will then start a new project as yet undecided .
maybe yoda can add some inspiration : `` do .
or do not .
there is no try . ''

documents.title: help for businesses affected by superbowl blaze
text: more than 20 traders affected by the fire that destroyed an indoor market and bowling alley in great yarmouth attended a drop-in advice session organised by the borough council today .
several alternative trading locations put forward by the council were identified as suitable , and these will be investigated further .
the council will also provide advice to any affected businesses looking to find its own premises .
the council is also investigating the possibility of pro-rata business rate relief for the 40-50 businesses that were unable to trade as a result of the fire on friday and over the weekend .
businesses which are no longer able to trade have already been removed from the business rate system .
several traders have said they would struggle with the upfront costs of buying new fixtures and fittings , and anyone with spares is asked to contact enterprisegy .
the free loan of a number of market stalls for indoor or outdoor use has been offered by ray linge market stalls , based in essex .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: public safety 'a priority ' following great yarmouth fire
text: great yarmouth borough council says public safety remains its top priority following the blaze that destroyed the regent superbowl on friday .
the council said it was been working with the centre 's owner , phil thompson , to ensure public risk remains low until the site is demolished and cleared .
tomorrow a contractor for mr thompson will take over from the fire service the responsibility for damping down the rubble .
on monday , the contractor will start work to install hoardings around the site to further improve security .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: protesters 'will maintain a presence ' at play area
text: parents and children have been staging a sit-in at wymondham 's king 's head meadow play area since monday , in an attempt to thwart town council plans to move it to a different site in the town .
now norfolk county council has been called in to mediate in the bitter row , arranging talks between the two sides , and contractors have been called off .
but dave roberts , one of the protesters , said he was very wary about the latest development .

people are very sceptical at the moment , the fencing 's still here we might calm things down but we 're going to keep a presence at the park in daytime and keep our ears pinned back to hear what 's going on it 's a suspension that could be changed at any moment . ''
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: so what is electrofishing ?
text: earlier we told you about the discovery of a rare fish , a bullhead - the first recorded in the river bure .
it was found during an electrofishing survey carried out by the environment agency - but what is electrofishing ?
fisheries officer jon clarke explains what 's involved :
`` a section or river , maybe 150m wide , is barriered off .

we go up and down in boats with a generator passing small electric currents into the water - about 5-6 amps , 120 volts - this draws the fish in towards a netsman he puts them in bins full of water and we capture the population of fish in the area . ''
are the fish stunned ?
`` some may be if they get close to the positive electrodes but they usually get immobilised . ''
once in the bins the fish are `` processed '' , says mr clarke .
`` they 're measured and the officers can see the different species .
some scales are taken off - and from these scales it 's possible to see the age of a fish , like in a tree ; see how fast the fish is growing , and how old they are that classifies the river . ''
once the river is classified , it is used as a biological indicator to say whether to river is good or bad , and anglers can get the data to see where to fish .

documents.title: demand for new property 'remains high ' says builder
text: homebuilders in norfolk may have to offer more features as standard to encourage buyers , according to tony abel of abel homes in norfolk , after a report out today from the royal institute of chartered surveyors suggested that house prices could drop .
mr abel said demand for new homes remained high .

we 're continuing to sell and have n't noticed any difference at all i think what 's important is to try and give people value for money - we concentrate hard on energy ratings , a ratings , and fibre-optic broadband to the home things that people really want without having to pay extra for them . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: demand for terraced houses in great yarmouth , despite housing slow-down
text: a new report suggests the housing market in the east of england is slowing down .
the royal institute of chartered surveyors says prices are expected to fall over the next year .
it 's reporting fewer sales , new inquiries and houses coming onto the market .
but great yarmouth-based estate agent charles boycott says business is doing well .

there 's a shortage of terraced houses despite the fact the government increased the stamp duty for people buying-to-let , the demand has continued and we 're finding at the moment that supply is n't as good as we 'd expect it to be at this time of year . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

text: man charged with baby 's manslaughter

documents.title: 'inadequate ' children 's services 'can be turned around '
text: the man responsible for norfolk 's children 's services says he 's confident the department can be turned around .
roger smith took responsibility for the department three months ago - it was rated inadequate by ofsted in 2013 .
a recent independent report , headed by dave hill of essex county council , says it 's improving but not fast enough , and has `` one chance left '' to get better .
the council is getting £ 7m of extra government funding , and has been partnered with the children 's charity barnado 's to improve its services for looked-after children .
mr smith said he was sure the department would get better .

we 're going to have advice , money and support from outside and increased capacity to build our leadership team - some of those are social workers - and we 're going to have a whole-team approach within the council . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: man charged over death of baby girl
text: a 40-year-old man has been charged with manslaughter in connection with the death of a six-month-old girl .
police were called on 26 february following reports milana guzas had been taken to the queen elizabeth hospital with suspected head injuries .
she was later transferred to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge , where she died on 2 march .
arunas guzas , of greenland avenue , king 's lynn , was charged earlier today by detectives from the joint norfolk and suffolk major investigation team .
he was remanded in custody and is due to appear at norwich magistrates ' court later today .

documents.title: police investigate 'death threats ' against transport company
text: police have told bbc radio norfolk they 're investigating death threats made against a haulage firm .
matthews international transport in great yarmouth has been criticised over how it handled the death of driver paul stanyard in italy .
since the story spread on social media , threats have been made against the firm .
the company told the family of mr stanyard ( above ) its insurance would n't cover bringing his body back , but it has offered to pay £ 5,000 towards the cost of repatriation .

our research shows the average cost of repatriation from europe is £ 3,800 and what we 've offered would more than cover the cost of paul 's repatriation we do believe as a family business we could have dealt with things better all we can do is learn from this and hopefully anything like this will never happen again . ''

documents.title: warning after building site thefts
text: norfolk police have issued a warning following a spate of crimes on building sites in norwich and south norfolk .
more than 10 crimes have been recorded since the beginning of august .
the most recent was at a housing developement on carr lane , poringland .
several properties were broken into and tools of two independent subcontractors were taken between last friday and monday this week august .
ch insp nathan clark urges builders to remain vigilant , ensure adequate security for tools , taking them with them when leaving the site .

documents.title: speedway : king 's lynn thrashed at poole
text: the king 's lynn stars were comprehensively beaten at reigning elite league champions poole last night .
the norfolk side went down 65-25 with rory schlein the best lynn rider , finishing with six points .
the two sides meet again at the adrian flux arena tonight .
they 'll be without no.1 niels-kristian iversen , who has made himself unavailable due to his hectic schedule which includes saturday 's swedish grand prix .

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: mediators called in over play area dispute
text: norfolk county council has stepped in to try to solve a dispute in wymondham , where parents and children have staged a sit-in to protest against the removal of play equipment .

wymondam town council had appointed contractors to remove play equipment from king 's head meadow , following complaints about noise and anti-social behaviour from residents , but they were unable to access the site land due to the demonstrators , who have been at the site since monday .
the council has now taken up an offer of mediation from norfolk county council to seek an amicable solution .
work on the site has been suspended and the contractors have been instructed to remove fencing that had been installed .

documents.title: rare fish found in norfolk river
text: the finding of a fish which is rare to norfolk rivers has given experts confidence that water quality is the best in years .
the environment agency has carried out a fish survey on the river bure , south of the former raf coltishall , and discovered five times more fish than in its last survey in 2010 .
as well as dace , roach , perch and pike , a freshwater fish called the bullhead was found in the river when officers carried out an electrofishing survey .

BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: fund-raising appeal to bring dead driver 's body home raises more than £ 20,000
text: family and friends of a truck driver who died abroad have launched an online appeal to raise funds , after he faced a pauper 's burial in italy .
paul stanyard , 60 , from wakefield , west yorkshire , died of natural cases in ancona while working overseas for matthews international transport .
the great yarmouth-based transport firm 's insurance covered the cost of bringing his vehicle back but not his body .

mr stanyard 's long-time friend and former trucker malcolm harper ( below ) , who now runs a scarborough guesthouse , has helped the family raise funds for repatriation and a funeral , with the total now well over £ 20,000 .

it 's been awful you feel like you 're begging we could have had him buried in italy but we did n't even have the money for that and he 'd have probably gone in a pauper 's grave it 's been crazy and i 'm so thankful to everybody . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: haulage firm 'could have handled driver 's death better '
text: a haulage boss has apologised to the family of a lorry driver who died when working overseas , saying it was never the company 's intention to let them down .
great yarmouth-based matthews international transport covers its drivers against accident and injury .
when paul stanyard died in italy it arranged for his vehicle to be brought home , but not his body as mr stanyard died of natural causes .
his family and friends launched an online appeal after mr stanyard faced a pauper 's burial .

we have received death threats as a family and our employees have been told to seek work elsewhere we could have handled things better , we should have handled things better and i do feel the death threats are unjust . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail travel for bank holiday journeys
text: it 's been a day dominated by news of trains , but before we go , here 's one more update for you .
it 's been announced that a rail replacement bus service will operate over the august bank holiday while the main line between norwich and ipswich is closed for the replacement of a new bridge .
the bridge carries the line over long john hill in norwich , and the replacement structure has been built on adjacent land so that the railway can be closed for a short a time as possible .
it has a flat underside , instead of an archway , to minimise the likelihod of a vehicle hitting and damaging it .
one mile of track outside norwich will also be cleaned , allowing smoother journeys and more effective drainage .
network rail is also replacing new track at mile end , and crossrail construction work will continue along the route between shenfield and london liverpool street .
passengers travelling from suffolk and essex face less disruption , as the railway will remain open between ipswich and stratford .
the work is part of network rail 's railway upgrade plan .

documents.title: sit-in over play area continues
text: a protest aimed at saving a play area in wymondham is now in its third day .
parents and children have been staging a sit-in at the playground on king 's head meadow to stop contractors moving it to another part of the town .
it follows complaints about the noise levels at the site .
vikki cooper , who is 13 and uses the park , said : `` it 's like the only park that is accessible for everyone in my school .
and the little kids , they come after school all the time , and it 's just the best park in wymondham . ''
the town council says the play area needs to be removed because local people were n't properly consulted before it was recently extended .

documents.title: great yarmouth fire landlord 'relieved ' to know blaze was n't deliberate
text: the landlord of great yarmouth 's indoor market says the fire which destroyed the building may have started in an ice cream freezer .
the market and bowling alley above was completely burned out in the blaze which started in the early hours of friday morning .

phil thompson said : `` it 's a relief , because you 're thinking the worst of everything - did someone get in and do something - but obviously that 's not the case , which is lovely , absolutely brilliant .
`` but for a freezer to cause this devastation is terrible , but there you go . ''
norfolk fire and rescue service confirmed the fire had started through `` an electrical circuit or item '' , but said the investigation was still ongoing .

documents.title: biggest rail boost 'since victorian era '

documents.title: companies express disappointment over failed bids
text: the two companies that were also in the bidding process for the rail franchise , national express and first rail , have spoken of their disappointment over their unsuccessful bids .

a national express spokesman said : `` we are naturally disappointed because we delivered a disciplined bid that balanced significant customer improvement with excellent value to taxpayers and a fair return for shareholders .
`` we are seeking feedback on our bid from the department for transport . ''

meanwhile , managing director of first rail , steve montgomery , said : `` we are disappointed not to have been given the opportunity to deliver a reliable and high-quality rail service for passengers in east anglia .
`` our bid was compelling and deliverable .
had it been selected , it would have provided excellent value for the taxpayer , vastly improved performance and capacity , and a step change in customer service . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: region will be 'open for business ' but 'norwich in 90 ' still some way off for most
text: investment of £ 1.4bn in rail services across east anglia will boost productivity in the economy and send out a signal that the region is open for business .
this announcement , along with the completion of the dualling of the a11 in 2014 , will help to change perceptions of the east as a business location .
however abellio 's norwich in 90 '' promise deserves a little more scrutiny .
the train company is only promising to run two services a day from norwich to london in each direction in 90 minutes .
each day there are 35 services in each direction to london , so the majority of passengers will still have services slower than 90 minutes .
abellio says because its new trains will be faster than the ones they replace , average journey times on the norwich to london line will fall from 112 minutes currently to 100 minutes from may 2020 .
a significant improvement , though perhaps not good enough for those expecting norwich in 90 '' .
author: Richard Bond
BBC Look East business correspondent

documents.title: abellio deal a 'huge win '
text: the mp for norwich north , who led a campaign to improve train services in east anglia , said she was particularly pleased that the abellio announcement meant new trains .
`` today we can say the train you are travelling in is less likely to break down because it 's brand new , '' said conservative chloe smith .
`` that 's what we 've achieved today .
it 's a huge win , and i am so proud to have led the campaign that has achieved it . ''

documents.title: analysis : how the campaign for better rail services came into being
text: today 's announcement on the new rail franchise comes after a costed rail manifesto was drawn up detailing all the changes needed in the region , and follows dozens of questions in parliament , special debates and meetings with ministers .
led by norwich north mp chloe smith and ipswich mp ben gummer , a co-ordinated campaign was put into action , leaving no-one in any doubt about the need for rail improvements in the east .

uniting behind the aspiration of norwich to london in 90 minutes , and norwich to ipswich in 60 , they lobbied for more investment by network rail in the region ( which is starting to happen ) and for a longer franchise to give the new operator time the incentive to invest in new rolling stock .
and , as part of that new franchise , there would be tough requirements on the operator to improve journey times , increase services and provide a better customer experience .
but getting to today is just part of the campaign .
now mps have to ensure that the new operator delivers .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: analysis : rail franchise follows long lobbying campaign
text: for too long east anglia has been unloved in rail terms - that 's going to change . ''
the comments of transport secretary chris grayling this morning sum up the importance of today 's announcement .

this new nine-year franchise , with its tough requirements of improved service levels and new rolling stock , is the result of a long campaign by the business community and particularly the region 's mps .
shorter franchises had failed to bring about any major changes to rail services in east anglia for years and there was a perception outside the region that we were a rural undeveloped backwater .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: transport secretary : 'every single carriage ' will be replaced in new franchise deal
text: transport secretary chris grayling says the new franchise deal will mean the years of east anglia 's rail passengers being `` under-loved '' are over .

referring to new carriages being planned under the deal , which covers a region stretching from hertfordshire in the west to suffolk in the east , said : `` they will be state-of-the-art , there will be a big improvement in terms of capacity , there 'll be more seats for passengers , so this should transform the passenger experience .
`` there 's no doubt the east anglian region has been under-loved in rail terms for a long time and those people who use the service will say they have n't had new trains .

`` now they 're going to get them and they 're going to get them right across the network , and every single carriage is going to be replaced and i think it will transform the experience of people who travel on the trains in east anglia . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: abellio contract 'probably a good thing '
text: the decision to award the contract to run rail services between london , cambridge and norwich , to incumbent operator abellio is `` probably a good thing , '' according to rail future east anglia .
chris burton from the rail campaigning group said the abellio deal provided `` continuity '' , but the dutch-owned company `` now has to really deliver '' .

documents.title: rail service now the 'golden thread ' running through east
text: the new rail franchise is a `` golden thread '' running through the east and will bring a great opportunities for the region , says mark pendlington , chairman of the new anglia local enterprise partnership .
he said : `` today we celebrate ; tomorrow we get an even better rail service .

`` this will mean an over £ 4bn boost to the economy , in ipswich alone , something like over 10,000 jobs , with 50,000 overall across the three counties , so this is saying to the world that the east is open for business .

`` this is a great place to live , work and learn , and this rail service is now the golden thread that runs through that economy , and allows it all to take off and for some very exciting things to happen . ''
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pooley takes on time trial in rio
text: norfolk 's emma pooley today takes on the time-trial course in rio in her last chance for another olympic medal .
the former norwich high school for girls pupil came out of retirement after seeing the course in brazil - it suits her ability to deal with long climbs .
pooley won silver at the bejing olym in 2008 , but could only manage sixth at london 2012 .
you can follow news from the time trial and the rest of the olym on the bbc sport website .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: abellio wins rail franchise - but what does it mean ?
text: abellio has won the franchise to continue delivering rail services in the eastern region for the next nine years .
it has promised to deliver a £ 1.4bn boost to rail services , and more than 1,000 new carriages .

this is a long franchise , and it contains some strict requirements on the operator to dramatically improve journey times and the passenger experience , as a result of a four-year campaign by local mps and the business community .

it promises to deliver one of the biggest orders for british-built trains - almost £ 1bn for 660 carriages from the bombardier factory in derby - as part of a contract that will secure 1,000 jobs into the next decade .
the group must also stick to tough new targets for operational performance levels .
author: Kate Williams
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murray walker pays tribute to racing driver jack sears
text: earlier we mentioned the death of norfolk racing driver jack sears .
the winner of the inaugural british touring cars series in 1958 , he died at the weekend aged 86 .

doyen of the motor racing world murray walker said mr sears , who was born in northampton , was `` an absolutely charming , cheerful , friendly , impeccably dressed , wonderful mannered man who was a norfolk farmer who also happened to be a gigantic and successful racing driver . ''
speaking to bbc radio norfolk 's matthew gudgin , mr walker described sears as `` enormously talented and could put his hand to anything behind a steering wheel and do well . ''

look at his record - he won the 1958 british touring car championships , which was the first championship to be held for the btcc , in an austin westminster and then he won it again in a 7 litre ford galaxy jack sears was one of the prime movers of the british racing drivers club at silverstone and he will be well and truly missed . ''

documents.title: fire-hit traders invited to drop-in meeting
text: great yarmouth traders who 've been affected by the regent road fire have been invited to a drop-in session at the catalyst centre , in the conge , on thursday morning .
the meeting is to discuss their needs and options with the council , in relation to potential alternative accommodation .
the borough council says it 's investigating potential locations from which they could trade after listening to people 's ideas .
it 's working with a commercial property agent as many of the properties suggested at privately-owned .
public safety remains a priority for the council .

after liaising with the health and safety executive , the owner of the regent superbowl has been required to install a more secure fence around the site , taking over responsibility for damping down the rubble from the fire service .
updates on the recovery process from the fire are posted on a dedicated page of the council 's website .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

seven crews from suffolk and norfolk were called to the fire just after midday .
it took them about two and a half hours to fight the flames .

documents.title: jack sears : tributes paid to racing driver
text: the world of motorsport is paying tribute to jack sears who has died at the age of 86 .
nicknamed `` gentleman jack '' , he was the winner of the inaugural british touring cars series back in 1958 .
the british automobile racing club confirmed that the northampton-born driver , who lived in ashill , norfolk , died on saturday night .

the next dunlop msa british touring car championship ( btcc ) event , which takes place this weekend at knockhill ( 13-14 august ) , will be marked with a minute 's silence as a tribute to mr sears , who farmed in west norfolk .
btcc series director alan gow said : `` it is with great regret and genuine sadness to learn of jack 's death .
i really liked jack a lot not only as an extremely talented and inspirational racing driver , but more importantly as a hugely popular , humble and impressive human being . ''

documents.title: wymondham play area dispute : the council says
text: let 's return to our story on the dispute in wymondham , where parents and children staged a protest over the council 's plans to remove a play area after noise complaints .
we 've now heard from the town council who tell us the installation of the play equipment on kings head meadow was authorised by the councillors who served in the 2011-2015 administration .
the current council says the play equipment was not suitable and did not follow guidelines .
it went on say families whose homes are near the play area may only be a small proportion of the residents of wymondham , but they have equal rights .
the council added : `` it 's been suggested the noise has been exaggerated .
to experience noise affecting the residents one only has to stand in their gardens or houses to really appreciate the effect . ''
the equipment that is being removed from kings head meadow will be reinstalled elsewhere so there is no loss of play equipment for the children in the town .

documents.title: shifting sands reveal freighter hazard in blakeney harbour
text: if you 've been to blakeney recently and wondered what the trinity house vessels mv galatea and mv alert have been doing we 've got the answer .
they 've been working with volunteers from the blakeney harbour association , repositioning a warning buoy to mark the point where a norwegian freighter sank a century ago .
in the last year , the entrance to the harbour channel has shifted half-a-mile eastwards .
it 's exposed the wreck of the ss hjordis which sank off blakeney point in 1916 and is now posing a hazard .
association secretary charlie ward says just how far the channel has moved over a very short space of time is `` astounding . ''

with the wreck now in the middle of the channel and the channel continuing to move east , there is a lot of work for our volunteers to do , frequently re-buoying the harbour entrance channel to keep pace with these changes . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shipwreck hazard for harbour users
text: the wreck of a norwegian ship that went down off the north norfolk coast a century ago is now posing a hazard to vessels coming in and out of the harbour channel .
in the last year the channel at blakeney point has moved half-a-mile to the east , uncovering the wreck of the ss hjordis .
the flow of water around the 976-ton collier has scoured her out .
blakeney harbour association has been keeping harbour users updated on the situation
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: marine watchdog warns of carbon monoxide on boats after couple die
text: earlier we told you about a video that 's been released by the marine accident investigation branch ( maib ) , highlighting the dangers of carbon monoxide on boats .
it was filmed on board the love for lydia in which essex couple alan frost and tina wilkins died in june this year near wroxham , along with their pet dog .
they were suffocated when the gas , known as the `` silent killer '' , was blown into the boat 's living accommodation after they 'd left the engine running .
the maib says it 's important for all boat users to be aware of the symptoms of carbon monoxide which can kill in under three minutes .
and it 's source ?
it can come from any appliance fuelled by oils , solid fuel or gas .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

barrier installation is expected to take several hours , and the partial closure of the roundabout will be lifted no later than 06:00 on saturday .
this arm of the roundabout will then be reduced to a single lane .

documents.title: postwick junction restrictions brought forward
text: the overnight installation of protective barriers for the construction of a segregated left turn lane on the postwick junction 's north west roundabout has been brought from from saturday to this friday .
it 's to avoid the disruption of football traffic following norwich city 's saturday evening match against sheffield wednesday - the kick-off is 17:30 .

the segregated left turn lane is designed to improve the flow of traffic through postwick junction during the morning rush hour when queues built up through the traffic lights and the oaks lane roundabout .

documents.title: broads boat hire company has fitted gas detectors
text: the deaths of alan frost and tina wilkins , along with their pet dog aboard a boat near wroxham , has prompted a warning to boaters about the dangers of carbon monoxide .

the fitting of carbon monoxide alarms on boats is not a legal requirement , but at £ 20 a time wroxham-based boating company barnes brinkcraft has fitted them to all its 75 hire boats , and spent £ 1000 on an air analyser to monitor gas levels .
director daniel thwaites told me they decided last year to put carbon monoxide detectors on all their hire boats , regardless of whether they have gas or not .
only about 20 % of our boats have gas , but it 's for peace of mind of the customer so they know that there 's something there to help them if there 's a problem . ''
author: Kim Riley
BBC Look East

documents.title: ambulance crews 'chase targets not patients '
text: north norfolk mp norman lamb says ambulance crews are being forced to chase targets instead of getting to the patients who most urgently need support .
the former lib dem health secretary was speaking following the latest care quality commission ( cqc ) report into the east of england ambulance service , which says it needs to improve .

paramedics racing to one call and then being diverted halfway to reach another call and sometimes being diverted again because another potential call is about to 'breach ' the national target the targets have to make sure that they 're prioritising the really urgent cases where it 's critical to get to a patient within a specified period of time . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ambulance boss says trust has an action plan to bring in improvements
text: following today 's report from the cqc saying the east of england ambulance trust requires improvement - the trust 's chief executive has paid tribute to staff and volunteers .
robert morton said : `` i am absolutely delighted that this report recognises the outstanding care we provide to patients , day in day out .
we are the only ambulance service to get an outstanding rating . ''
he added : `` we have made huge steps forward over the last year and this progress is reflected in the report .
`` we know we have more work to do , to move us from 'requires improvement ' to 'good ' , and we have in place a plan to address the points raised by the cqc .

`` the report identifies the need to increase our staffing levels so that we can respond to the increases in demand we are seeing we continue to work with our commissioners and the nhs to discuss and address this issue , '' he said .

documents.title: two airports in the east rated 'very good ' for disabled passengers ' service
text: two airports in the east of england have been rated `` very good '' for the quality of assistance it provides for passengers with a disability or reduced mobility .
the performance report , by the uk civil aviation authority , assessed 30 uk airports against a number of measures including how long passengers have to wait for assistance on arrival and departure .
norwich and london southend were two of 10 airports to receive the `` very good '' rating .
in our region london stansted was ranked `` good '' , with london luton found to be `` taking steps '' .
edinburgh was the only airport to be judged `` poor '' .

documents.title: gas can become a killer within three minutes
text: the marine accident investigations branch ( maib ) has issued a warning to boat users about the deadly dangers of carbon monoxide gas .
it follows their initial investigations into the deaths of a couple and their dog at wroxham broad in june .
alan frost and tina wilkins , from grays in essex , had left their engine running with a canvas canopy covering the back of their boat .
a slight wind caused carbon monoxide fumes from the engine to get beneath the canopy and into the living quarters .
tests by investigators have found the levels of this silent killer would have become high in less than three minutes .
whether you have a canvas top or not , so long as there 's an enclosed space in which the gas can accumulate , then it 's potentially lethal .
it 's a natural reaction to pull canopies up if it 's cold , but users have to be careful . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

they had left their engine running and the boat 's canvas canopy had filled with carbon monoxide .

text: a health watchdog has rated norfolk 's ambulance service as `` requiring improvement '' in a new report .
the care quality commission praised staff care , but said that they were under significant pressure and failing to meet response time targets .
denise burke , from the act on ambulances campaign , says the report does n't tell us anything that we did n't already know and that there 's been a problem in rural areas for a number of years .

documents.title: mp says it should n't be her job to press ambulance service for answers
text: a conservative mp who has long campaigned for improvements in the ambulance service , says the need to improve response times has been going on `` for far too long '' .

suffolk coastal mp therese coffey , speaking after a health watchdog rated the east region 's ambulance service as `` requiring improvement '' in a new report , said : `` they keep talking about demand rising and i want to know where the demand is coming [ from ] .
`` that 's the kind of thing we need to get into though i 'll be honest , that should be their job , not necessarily the role of the mp to be pressing them on different areas . ''

documents.title: ambulance service rated as 'requiring improvement ' by cqc
text: health watchdog the care quality commission has rated the east region 's ambulance service as `` requiring improvement '' in its latest report .
the report , published this morning , shows the east of england ambulance service trust was inspected twice in april .

it says the service is under significant pressure and is failing to meet performance standards and targets for responding to 999 calls - an issue highlighted when a newmarket town footballer had to wait three hours for an ambulance to arrive at the weekend after he was injured on the pitch in essex .
there are also recruitment issues , along with poor training of staff to deal more appropriately with patients suffering with dementia or mental health problems .
there is good news , however , when it comes to patient care , with it being rated in that area as `` outstanding '' .
we 'll bring you reaction to this shortly .

documents.title: appeal for help with lifeboat fundraising event
text: volunteers are needed to help one of norfolk 's biggest lifeboat fundraiser events get off the ground .

but organisers say they need a helping hand after the people supplying both their stage and their public address system let them down with just days to go .
alan jones , one of the team behind the fun day , says they 're determined the event will go ahead .

one way or another we 'll make it happen we 've got a few people are pa-experienced but they do n't have the gear whether it 's build a stage , or someone who can hire a stage and lend it to us , or scaffolders willing to build a stage on the beach for us we 're struggling . ''

documents.title: council support work for those affected by great yarmouth fire
text: officers from great yarmouth borough council are continuing the monitor the site of the blaze that engulfed the indoor market and bowling alley early on friday .
they 're liaising with emergency services and the property owner , phil thompson , to ensure the site remains safe .
potential alternative buildings from which affected businesses could trade are also being investigated , and the council is willing to discuss a business rate holiday .
it says it continues to liaise with mr thompson , and will provide any advice and support within its remit to support the recovery .
the council has contributed £ 2,000 to a fighting fund to help affected businesses , working in partnership with the eastern daily press and norfolk community foundation .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: great yarmouth fire : council 's thanks for multi-agency response
text: great yarmouth borough council has thanked emergency services , staff and others who have been working with it following the fire at the regent superbowl early on friday morning .
the council said officers were on-site within half an hour of the blaze starting , and an emergency rest centre was opened in the marina centre for residents .
by friday night , the site of the fire was secured and made safe with fencing , and power had been restored to 100 households .
an emergency phone number for affected businesses was set up , with 12 businesses getting in touch over the weekend .
on saturday , damaged windows opposite the fire scene were made safe and later a 3m ( 3yds ) walkway was opened past the site , reconnecting regent road for businesses and tourists .
in a statement , the council said its immediate priorities were public safety and supporting the affected businesses .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parents and children protest at plans to move play area
text: dozens of parents and children are staging a sit-in in wymondham to protest at plans to move a play area .

there have been complaints about noise at the playground in king 's head meadow , and earlier this year the town council backed plans to move the play equipment to a new part of town at a cost of £ 60,000 .
contractors arrived at the site today but their efforts to remove the equipment was thwarted by the protest .
wymondham fc is based at the meadow .
spokesman derek ward , who supports the parents , says the council wants to spend the money on moving the play area to another area which is n't accessible to disabled people .
it 's gone back to council twice , they 've still not backed down they came with contractors this morning , backed up by the police , and that 's how the sit-in started . ''
we have approached the town council for comment but they have not come back to us .
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: alternative accommodation looked at for market traders
text: alternative accommodation for traders who lost their businesses in the burnt-out regent superbowl is being looked for by great yarmouth 's borough council .
councillor barry coleman tells me the council has been in discussions with the owners of the victoria arcade , where a dozen small units are available .

when i put to him the possibility of traders moving to the recently-vacated bhs store , mr coleman , chairman of the council 's economic development committee , said the option seemed `` like a very good idea '' and that the council would investigate with the landlord .

he said the loss of the indoor market and bowling alley was a `` great blow '' for the town and holiday industry , but it 's `` a relatively small part of the whole tourist industry all other businesses are open and it 's important for the tourist industry that people keep coming '' .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: travel : a47 closed in both directions
text: the a47 is closed in both directions at great yarmouth following a crash between three cars .
one person has been taken to the james paget hospital at gorleston with minor injuries .
the road is blocked between the a12 runham roundabout and branch road .
diversions are in place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: greater anglia warns of delays on mainline service tonight
text: # kelvedon - this is affecting services towards london only .
trains from clacton , ipswich , norwich and colchester directions affected .
rh
today from 21:05 : rail replacement bus services will operate between colchester and witham ( this direction only ) : gk

documents.title: 'bitter ' businessman criticises council after fire
text: i 've been speaking to phil thompson , owner of the burnt-out regent superbowl and indoor market , which was engulfed by flames on friday morning .
mr thompson ( above ) is critical of great yarmouth borough council 's response to the fire , telling me he 's `` bitter '' .

he says all he wants is for someone from the council to come and stand by him and `` say 'let 's sort this out together ' i 'm insured but because of the colossal amount of clearing the site , £ 1m , i do n't know if my insurance is going to be enough '' .
penny carpenter , deputy council leader , said its staff had been working really well , and were on duty from 04:00 , shortly after the fire broke out on friday .

we 've opened up a rest centre , we 've actually been here all the time - our staff have been with residents to make sure they 're ok , our housing department has been helping them - we 've been working really well . ''
author: Kim Riley
BBC Look East

documents.title: collections held for fire-hit market traders
text: three days after the great yarmouth fire , and firefighters are still damping down hot-spots in the ruins of the bowling alley and indoor market .
the partly-opened regent road is packed with holidaymakers .
collections have been organised for the market traders , many uninsured , who have lost their businesses .
the fire has dealt a heavy blow to the town at the height of the summer season .
the aim , to have a new complex in place by next summer , is quite a challenge .
author: Kim Riley
BBC Look East

documents.title: fire-hit trader : 'i 'll be a barrow boy again '
text: i 've been to great yarmouth where firefighters have been checking the ruins of the bowling alley and indoor market which was destroyed in a fire on friday morning .
some of the traders were uninsured , and have met today to see if they can raise enough money to keep going .
richard king ( below ) told me money raised would go directly to the traders , as `` some of these guys have got to put food on the table and they 've got mortgages to pay '' .
another trader , jonathan hanks ( below ) , has spent 30 years working but his business , sock stop , is now a pile of rubble .
he was uninsured but says he 's determined to be up and running tomorrow .

i started off working on a table built up with wooden tomato boxes and a piece of chipboard if i have to use the firewood from behind me and the crates that sit there , i 'll make a table and somehow i 'll be a barrow boy again . ''
author: Kim Riley
BBC Look East

documents.title: olympic success likely to boost interest in swimming , says club
text: one of norfolk 's leading swimming clubs is expecting a rise in membership following britain 's success at the rio olym
adam peaty , 21 , won team gb 's first gold medal in .
men 's swimming at this level since 1988 .

john digby from norwich swans says the club has already seen a massive rise in interest since the 2012 games : `` numbers in our learn-to-swim classes and our squads have grown dramatically over the years .

`` our learn-to-swim lessons for september are full across the board in almost all the pools we 've got already and it 'll be interesting to see what happens on the phone in the next few weeks as the successes come through . ''

documents.title: indoor market owner wants to rebuild it
text: the owner of the indoor market in great yarmouth which went up in flames has said he wants it .
to be rebuilt within a year .
phil thompson , who has owned the market for four years , said he wanted to build it bigger and better '' , adding : `` i would like to see it rebuilt in 12 months or less but i need help .
i need that help for the good of the town .
i 've been here all my life ; it 's part of me as well . ''
a meeting of 42 traders took place this morning to discuss how to move forward after the fire .
suggestions included using the now-vacant bhs store in the town for the market .

documents.title: afternoon weather : sunny spells
text: feeling pleasant in the sunshine this afternoon , with a top temperature of 20c ( 68f ) .
one or two showers are possible .
today 's photograph was taken in wells-next-the-sea by weather watcher lucylibby .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: firefighters dampen down hot-spots
text: more damping down has been needed on the site of a major fire in great yarmouth .
the indoor market and bowling alley on regent road was destroyed by flames on friday .
crews returned this morning after reports that the ashes were starting to smoulder .
investigations into the cause of the fire are continuing today .
matthew clutten , station officer at great yarmouth , says it 's too early to speculate on the cause at this stage .
author: Janet Harnden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norwich city chairman planning 12 hours a week training for strictly
text: despite having run three london marathons , norwich city chairman ed balls says he 's trying to get fit , now that he 's been confirmed as a contestant in this year 's strictly come dancing .
he told chris evans : `` from the beginning of september , i 'm definitely going to be doing 12 hours a week training but everybody says i 'll have to do quite a few more hours than that . ''
he added : `` our family have been massive fans of strictly for years .
i 've taken the view that if you have a midlife crisis , make sure you plan it well and enjoy every minute . ''

documents.title: former children 's home boss jailed
text: former children 's home boss jailed

documents.title: ed balls 'scared to death ' over strictly come dancing
text: norwich city chairman is the first contestant confirmed for the next series of bbc one 's strictly come dancing .
speaking to chris evans on the radio 2 breakfast show , the former shadow chancellor said he was `` scared to death '' .
strictly come dancing will return to bbc one next month .
head judge len goodman is stepping down after this series .
`` it 's a dream come true , '' said balls .
`` and to do len 's last series , my only hope is it stays a dream and does n't become a nightmare . ''

documents.title: oates considering future after olympic blow
text: norfolk judo star colin oates accepts he may have lost his chance of becoming an olympic medallist after being knocked out in the first round in rio .
the north lopham man will be 37 by the time of the next olym in tokyo in 2020 .
oates told the bbc : `` i think british judo will look to youth for the next four years and maybe they 're right to do so .
i 'll try and stay involved in the sport in some way , shape or form . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: disappointment for norfolk duo in rio
text: one of norfolk 's medal hopes at the olym suffered a controversial defeat in the first round of the 66kg judo in rio .
north lopham 's colin oates was beaten by france 's kilian le blouch after their bout went to a golden score and the norfolk man committed a third shido , or foul , leaving le blouch to progress .
in cycling , norwich 's emma pooley did n't finish the women 's road race in which her great britain team-mate lizzie armitstead finished fifth .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: combine harvester goes up in flames
text: more than 40 firefighters tackled a blaze at west bilney , near king 's lynn , on sunday afternoon after a combine harvester went up in flames .
ten crews were called out just after 16:00 as flames spread to crops being harvested at the farm near the a47 .
it took about two hours to put out the fire and crews remained on site damping down hot spots into the evening .
two crews returned at about 05:00 this morning , norfolk fire service told us , after the fire reignited .
it has since been extinguished .
it is not yet known what caused the fire , but no-one was injured .
firefighters also dealt with field fires in colkirk , wells and saxthorpe , and other grass fires over the weekend .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: alex neil : canaries proved they 're mentally ready for the championship
text: norwich city 's barnstorming start to the championship season proved that their players will approach the season in the right way , according to manager alex neil .
they began with an impressive 4-1 win at blackburn , racing into a 3-0 lead within half an hour with goals from jacob murphy , wes hoolahan and cameron jerome .

steven naismith added the fourth in the second half and neil told me afterwards : `` it 's going to be a long , hard season with lots of ups and downs but we 've shown people what we 're capable of . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: police and crime commissioner visits city 's clubland
text: the new police and crime commissioner for norfolk has joined police out on patrol on one of the busiest streets in the county .
lorne green joined officers on prince of wales road in the heart of norwich 's clubland .
it 's been described as the most dangerous street in norfolk .
mr green says he ca n't `` reflect the interests of the community in the police and crime plan unless i 'm out on the street , finding out what their interests are . ''
even in low-crime areas , people would like the assurance of seeing a patrol car pass once a fortnight , and occasionally see a bobby on the beat . ''

documents.title: traders hold meeting after devastating fire
text: traders from the indoor market in great yarmouth destroyed by fire are getting together this morning to see if they can raise money to keep going .
richard king has lost `` just about everything '' .
he was fully stocked up for the season , and says `` something like £ 60,000 has gone up in just a few hours . ''
we 're meeting to try and get something going , asking people to help - not to help rebuild our businesses , but just to keep people 's lives going . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire-hit traders 'must pull together '
text: a trader who owned a unit in the indoor market beneath the regent superbowl says the fire has meant `` financial ruin '' for businesses .
jonathan hanks said people in the indoor market lost everything , and could n't get insurance because of the state of the building .
mr hanks says the traders have got to `` pull together '' .
he also owns a sausage business nextdoor that has survived , and says he 's opening today and will give half of what he makes towards helping the traders .
the fire marshall gave us two minutes to grab anything we could that was salvageable , and those people that have lost everything were there on the floor struggling in the dirt to help me . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: owner returns to scene of fire-damaged building
text: the owner of great yarmouth 's indoor market and bowling alley which was destroyed by fire has been down to the scene this morning .
many of those who had units say they were were uninsured and have lost everything .
phil thompson , who plans to rebuild the regent road complex in time for next summer 's season , says he ca n't understand the traders ' lack of insurance .
some traders told bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad that they could n't get insurance because of the state of the building and lack of sprinkler system .

they were offered insurance by different agents and i 've seen all the excuses they 've made i was insured so i 'm sure they could all be insured it did n't need a sprinkler system , it was all up to spec . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: apologies for earlier technical issues
text: we 're sorry we 've had a slightly delayed start to our live coverage today , as there have been a few technical issues nationally with the service .
hopefully they 've been sorted now , and it 'll soon be business as normal .
thanks for your patience .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: demolition work begins on fire-damaged building
text: demolition teams have begun work at a great yarmouth bowling alley and indoor market in great yarmouth which was destroyed by fire .
workers have been clearing rubble and asbestos , and securing dozens of broken windows .
they 've been dismantling the structure from the top for safety reasons and to minimise disruption to surrounding businesses .
firefighters remained at the regent road site over the weekend , damping down any hot-spots .
the blaze is one of the biggest that firefighters have dealt with in recent years .
fire investigators are due to return to the scene to conclude their work .

one or two showers are possible but the brisk wind will slowly ease .

any showers will ease this evening with long clear spells developing .
coupled with light winds it will be a chilly night , especially in rural spots .
lows of 9c ( 48f ) .
